data.title: Stevens Point, WI - Official Website
data.text:
August 12 City Committee Meeting Videos Online, on TV, & on Radio

The August 12 City Committee meeting videos are online. They will play on Community TV (Spectrum 984 & TDS 13) & on 105.9 FM WSNP-LP radio Tues., August 13 at 5 & 10:00 p.m., & Wed., August 14 at 7:30 a.m. For captions, watch on our YouTube channel. Watch the Videos in our Archives

Help Wanted - Electrical Inspector

This position reviews applications for electrical permits & completes the appropriate inspections relating to such permits to ensure compliance with electrical codes. Also assists other City inspectors with the enforcement of other codes & regulations. Get More Information and Apply

Help Wanted Volunteer Auxiliary Police Officer

Auxiliary Police work with the Police Dept. in maintaining order, carrying out lawful orders issued by members of the Police Dept., directing traffic, patrolling an assigned sector of the city, & other duties as assigned. Get More Information and Apply

Opening Reception – The Animal

The Riverfront Arts Center invites you to join them for the opening reception of "The Animal" on Thursday, August 22, from 4:30 to 7:00 pm. This show promises a captivating display of visual stories reflecting the power and elegance of animals. Read More

City Employees - "Helping You" Newsletter for August

In this month's "Helping You" Newsletter from UMR, you’ll find information about preventing and managing diabetes and prediabetes. You’ll also find other wellness-related articles and links for City employees. Read the August Newsletter

MDA Partners with Stevens Point Fire Fighters to Kick Off Annual Fill the Boot Campaign

Fill the Boot drives benefitting kids & adults with muscular dystrophy will be held August 29 & 30, proudly marking 70 years of partnership between the MDA and the International Assoc. of Fire Fighters, with a kickoff event on August 22 at Iverson Park. Read More

Fourth Ave. to Close Isadore to Reserve August 12 - 16

Fourth Ave. will close between Isadore St. and Reserve St. Monday, August 12 - Friday, August 16 for utility installation. It will reopen to all traffic once work is complete. This work is dependent on availability of crews, weather, and field conditions.

Mason St. to Close Park St. to Prairie St. Wednesday, August 7

Mason St. will close between Park St. & Prairie St. on Wednesday, August 7 for underground utility work. It will reopen over gravel in approximately three weeks. This work is dependent on weather, field conditions, and crew availability.

Elimination of Parking Kiosks

The City of Stevens Point has stopped using parking kiosks around the UW-Stevens Point campus and downtown. However, it will still use the Passport app for Pay for Parking areas and offer a Call to Pay to Park option for those without a smartphone. Read More

Help Wanted - Several Seasonal Positions at KB Willett Ice Arena

Now taking applications for Seasonal Building Supervisor / Zamboni Operator, Concessions Worker, Game Attendant/Building Custodian, Ice Skating Instructor, Skate Guard, and Skate Shop Attendant at the KB Willett Ice Arena. Apply by Oct. 31. Get More Information and Apply

Journalist Gene Kemmeter Recognized for Serving Community

Stevens Point Mayor Mike Wiza honored journalist Gene Kemmeter for more than 50 years of serving Portage County in journalism. He presented a proclamation at the Wooden Chair Restaurant before friends, former colleagues, and family. Read More

Grow Solar Program presents Solar Power Hour Informational Events

"Grow Solar Central Wisconsin" has returned for its seventh year, offering Stevens Point residents the opportunity to attend "Solar Power Hours" to learn about solar energy and how they can benefit from more affordable pricing through group purchasing. Read More

Board, Commission, and Committee Seats Available

Seats on the Stevens Point Bicycle/Pedestrian Street Safety Commission, Deer Management Committee, Historic Preservation/Design Review Commission, and Board of Zoning Appeals are open. Candidates must be residents of the city and at least 18 years old. Read More

Help Wanted - Firefighter/Paramedic

The Stevens Point Fire Dept. is accepting applications for Full Time Firefighter/Paramedic candidates to fill current vacancies. Lateral transfers may be considered. Pay is $5,359/month. Apply by 4:00 pm September 30, 2024. Get More Info & Apply for Firefighter/Paramedic

Help Wanted - Arborist

Performs forestry & landscaping, including but not limited to, planting, pruning, removal & caring for trees, landscape, turf, & plantings along City streets, parks & other City-owned properties, & more. Full time. $29.32/hr. Apply by 4 pm on August 16. Get More Info & Apply for Arborist

2024 Bicycle Friendly Community Public Survey

Please complete the public survey to help the League of American Bicyclists better understand local bicyclists' experiences and process the City of Stevens Point's application for renewed Silver-level "Bicycle Friendly Community" status. Complete the Public Survey

City Employees - EAP Newsletter for July

Did you know that dehydration can affect anxiety? If you aren’t drinking enough water, you might be going through unnecessary stress. There’s a significant link between dehydration and mood disturbances. See the EAP Newsletter (PDF)

City Needs Poll Workers for November Election

The City Clerk’s Office needs additional people interested in serving as election officials (poll workers) for the General Election on Tuesday, November 5, 2024. Election officials are paid $14.50 per hour for training and Election Day duties. Read More

Painting Workshop with Renee Denise at the Riverfront Arts Center

An outdoor painting workshop led by local artist Renee Denise will be held at the Riverfront Arts Center on Sept. 22, 10 am - 12 pm. Unleash your creativity & let your brushstrokes dance on the canvas as you capture the charm of Homer, the Highland Cow! Read More

City Requests Input for Creation of Aging Plan

Last year, the City of Stevens Point announced its intention to create a community aging plan. Stevens Point strives to be a livable community for people of all ages and abilities. A public survey allows stakeholders to provide input on the plan. Read More
